definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: Show love and appreciation generously to family and friends today.
sentences.chinese: 今天向家人和朋友表達愛意和感激。

sentences.english: A girl gave him a gold necklace of ten grams to express her love.
sentences.chinese: 一個女孩還送給他一條10克重的金項鍊來表達愛意。

sentences.english: If I were brave, I Iwould convey my love feelings to her.
sentences.chinese: 如果我有勇氣，我會向她表達我深深的愛意。

sentences.english: Peace on earth and good will towards everyday.
sentences.chinese: 願世界得以太平，人人充滿愛意。

sentences.english: Love comes to man through his senses , to woman through her imagination.
sentences.chinese: 男人靠觸感來啓發愛意，女人透過想像感受情愛。

sentences.english: When I first got married, I wanted to show my love to my new wife.
sentences.chinese: 新婚不久，我想對嬌妻表達自己的愛意。

sentences.english: The giraffes like to rub each other's neck.
sentences.chinese: 而長頸鹿則喜歡相互摩擦頸部來表達愛意。

sentences.english: Use her favorite color, blue, to write this letter to show my love to her.
sentences.chinese: 用她最愛的藍色寫下這封信，來表達我對她的愛意。

sentences.english: Have you taken time today to tell those that matter the most to you in this world that you love them?
sentences.chinese: 今天你向對你無比重要的那些人表達愛意了嗎？

sentences.english: She greeted him civilly but with no sign of affection.
sentences.chinese: 她禮貌地向他打招呼，但沒有一絲愛意。

sentences.english: Till her kind beams thy black so brightness turneth.
sentences.chinese: 只有她愛意的光芒纔可以讓你從黑轉白。

sentences.english: Rain to listen to stars Potaninia heart, I love Long Yuet height.
sentences.chinese: 淅瀝綿雨聽星心，朗月高空愛意真。

sentences.english: His loving sentiments tenderly played anew with each re-discovery.
sentences.chinese: 她每重新找出來看一次，丈夫的愛意便溫柔再現。

sentences.english: Some have even gone as far as professing their love and proposing marriage.
sentences.chinese: 有人甚至走得更遠，向他表達愛意和發出婚約。

sentences.english: I was amazed at the love they showed for one another.
sentences.chinese: 我對他們展現出的對彼此的愛意感到很驚訝。
它能增進親切感和愛意。

definition: in love with/to feel deeply attached to
to recount/to tell of/to relate/(fig.) (of a thing) to stand as testament to (some past history)
to get excited/passionate/aroused to passion/to fall in love/on heat (of animals)
to sound out/to probe/to feel out/to try out
partner (in four person game)/family of proposed marriage partner
to recount/to narrate/to give an account of
to worry about/to be concerned about
